sentences.sContent: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.sCn: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。
公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.sContent: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.sCn: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.sContent: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.sCn: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.sContent: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.sCn: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.sContent: ...this is the first time a panel has been designed to be laid directly on top existing roads and the first project to install the panels on public highways...
...But there are also public bills to be paid...
...The next largest amount of public money goes to teach and train our citizens...
...a large amount of public funds is spent on roads...
...Years ago the government made money by selling public lands...
...But most of the best public lands have now been sold...
...There are still some public lands that contain oil...

synos.tran: 公众的；政府的；公用的；公立的

phrases.pCn: n. 公共卫生；公共卫生设施
公共服务，公益服务；公用设施
公共交通，公共运输；公共交通工具
公共行政；公共管理；行政管理
公共图书馆；公立图书馆
公共福利，公用福利设施；社会福利
公共住房，政府为低收入者所建的住房
国营部门经济；政府资助的企事业；社会经济的公有部份

words.tran: 宣传，宣扬；公开；广告；注意
国际法学家；宣传人员；公法学家

trans.tranOther: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society
